title: Presidential transition of Jimmy Carter
added: Cater began planning for a prospective presidential transition in the spring of 1976, after he became the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]]'s presumptive nominee.<ref name="Vox1">{{cite web |last1=Skinner |first1=Richard |title=Jimmy Carter changed presidential transitions forever |url=https://www.vox.com/mischiefs-of-faction/2016/10/5/13142390/jimmy-carter-changed-presidential-transitions |website=Vox |access-date=4 February 2021 |language=en |date=5 October 2016}}</ref> This was far earlier than the two previous individuals to first assume the presidency by election, [[Richard Nixon]] and [[John F. Kennedy]], had begun planning for their transitions.<ref name="Vox1"/>

title: Presidential transition of Jimmy Carter
added: In 1976, legislation was passed which increased federal funding for presidential transitions to $2 million, an increase from the $450,000 that had been originally allotted under the [[Presidential Transition Act of 1963]].<ref>{{cite web |title=JUST ASK Where does the money come from to pay Bill Clinton's transition team expenses? |url=https://www.newspapers.com/image/138152401 |website=Newspapers.com |publisher=Democrat and Chronicle |access-date=2 February 2021 |language=en | url-access=subscription |date=13 Nov 1992}}</ref>

title: Presidential transition of Jimmy Carter
added: In 1976, legislation was passed which increased federal funding for presidential transitions to $2 millionfor the incoming president's transition effort and $1 million to the administration of the outgoing president, an increase from thetotal of$450,000 that had been originally allotted under the [[Presidential Transition Act of 1963]].<ref>{{cite web |title=JUST ASK Where does the money come from to pay Bill Clinton's transition team expenses? |url=https://www.newspapers.com/image/138152401 |website=Newspapers.com |publisher=Democrat and Chronicle |access-date=2 February 2021 |language=en | url-access=subscription |date=13 Nov 1992}}</ref>

title: Presidential transition of Jimmy Carter
added: During the transition, Carter reached out to some Ford administration officials, such as [[Stephen H. Hess]], for advice.<ref>{{cite web |title=Ford to Carter: Brookings and the 1976-77 Presidential Transition |url=https://www.brookings.edu/articles/ford-to-carter-brookings-and-the-1976-77-presidential-transition/ |website=Brookings |access-date=5 February 2021 |date=18 November 2008}}</ref>
